data.title: Most of the major newspapers in Uganda, apart from the government run paper, were raided and shut down by police last week. The government paper (The New Vision) that is still in operation has no mention of any of this on their website.
Thousands of Muslims gather in London to condemn murder of soldier Lee Rigby
Monsanto Found Guilty of Chemical Poisoning in Landmark Case
'I will gag the hate clerics': Cameron to launch new terror task force to bring an end to religious extremism
Dark, massive asteroid to fly by Earth on May 31
Canadian mine giant Barrick fined a record $16.4M in Chile. Native population complains of cancerous growths and aching stomachs
UK Government use beheading as excuse to push through failed cyber security bill
Islamists kill 21 in suicide attacks in Niger

A woman awaiting a transplant for a rare condition that has destroyed her kidneys had her operation cancelled at the 11th hour because the Government refused to pay for the drug she needs to prevent the organ being rejected
US-born Jewish terrorist receives two life sentences for murdering two Palestinians and wounding two Israelis in a series of violent attacks.
